where C is the constant of integration.

Now, I'll evaluate the definite integral from x = 1 to x = 3:

[(2/3)(3)^3 + (3/2)(3)^2 + 3] - [(2/3)(1)^3 + (3/2)(1)^2 + 1]

= [(2/3)(27) + (9/1)(9) + 3] - [(2/3)(1) + (3/2)(1) + 1]

= [18 + 81 + 3] - [2/3 + 3/2 + 1]

= 102 - (19/6)

= (613/6)

So, the definite integral of 2x^2 + 3x + 1 from 1 to 3 is 613/6.assistant
